snippet: Buck Showalter, a manager who pays attention to detail and has plenty of post-season experience, has led Baltimore to its first playoff berth since 1997.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column discusses the Baltimore Orioles, team that has at least clinched a wild card berth by beating the Tampa Bay Rays, 1-0, finally closing the book on its 14-year streak of losing seasons; praises Orioles right fielder Chris Davis, who tied Reggie Jackson's 1976 club record for consecutive games with a homer.
lead_paragraph: Buck Showalter, a manager who pays attention to detail and has plenty of post-season experience, has led Baltimore to its first playoff berth since 1997.

headline.print_headline: One Big Swing Keeps the Orioles Alive
headline.seo: Chris Davis’s Home Run Keeps the Orioles’ Hopes Alive
headline.main: One Big Swing Keeps the Orioles Alive
